{"doc":{"info":{"calaisRequestID":"bd079853-4267-fbf0-146f-22beedcd18b1","id":"http://id.opencalais.com/AfdQA2fyzUjSuWFSq2FVhQ","docId":"http://d.opencalais.com/dochash-1/1db0f04b-764b-3df1-9aad-166b0b8daacf","document":" ￼Democracy (from Rimbaud) The colours on parade, dipping past the filthy bricks ofthis garrison town. Boots, newly issued, stutter on the cobbles; but we can keep step. We\u2019ll be posted overseas, to the big Base Depots. White buildings in long straight lines, like the Big City itself, but with everything laid on, just for us. It\u2019ll be the biggest, best-run brothel in the world.Ifthestudentsriot,it\u2019llbeusreservistswho\u2019recalledout. East of Suez or thereabouts - where the cold beer is grateful to the clay that gurgles it up, and the temper rises nicely after meals. We\u2019ll make the black bastards work: leader-writers will talk about the Commonwealth. Anywhere, to get away from home. Glad to be back in the army, we\u2019ll use our loaves, all right. We can\u2019t pass exams, but we get our feet under the table. Everyone else can get fucked. Progress we call it. By- The- Right- Quick- MARCH s 71 \n￼Instruction for my Godson (for William Redgrove) God help me, I\u2019m supposed to see you\u2019re told All about God the Father. So my beard mutters: There are always two fathers, one Good and one Bad. You can\u2019t miss the Bad One, he\u2019s always around, Particularly first thing in the morning, Scruffy and screaming for a razor-blade, Wondering who to eat up for his breakfast - He won\u2019t eat you however much he shouts. I\u2019m not trying to sell you bad old Nobjidaddy - The Good One has a different way with clouds; he watches. He knows fifty-seven ways at least of looking at them, He addresses them politely, and his looking Can hold them still in the sky. Learn to shrug off his sessions on his throne Farting thunderbolts and belching clouds.
